name: Close-Grip Dumbbell Press
setup: Lie on flat bench with feet planted on floor
Hold dumbbells together touching over chest, palms facing each other (neutral grip)
Shoulder blades retracted and down, ribs stacked
steps: Lower dumbbells together toward chest, keeping them touching
Elbows stay close to torso (not flared out)
Descend until DBs touch chest or reach comfortable depth
Press dumbbells back up, keeping them together
Finish with arms extended, triceps engaged
mistakes: Letting dumbbells separate during the press
safety: If elbows or shoulders feel cranky, widen grip slightly or reduce load. Keep shoulder blades retracted to protect shoulder joints.

regressions: Floor press variation (reduces range of motion)
Tempo close-grip press (3-1-1) with lighter weight
progressions: Pause close-grip press (2s pause at chest)

prescriptionHints.notes: Excellent triceps builder. Start conservative; dumbbells touching increases instability and demand.

joints.notes: Keep elbows close to body to reduce shoulder stress. Avoid excessive arching or flaring.
